metadata.Title: CVE-2021-22959 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
The parser in accepts requests with a space (SP) right after the headername before the colon. This can lead to HTTP Request Smuggling (HRS) inllhttp < v2.1.4 and < v6.0.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-22959` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode72 - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3
nodejs - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3').
